verb.description: (especially of a car or aircraft) move or travel very quickly.
examples: we watched the fly zooming about
he jumped into his car and zoomed off

verb.description: (of a camera) change smoothly from a long shot to a close-up or vice versa.
examples: the camera zoomed in for a close-up of his face
zoom out for a wide view of the garden again

noun.description: A camera shot that changes smoothly from a long shot to a close-up or vice versa.

exclamation.description: Used to express sudden fast movement.
